body: I'm getting the same exact issue. It would be great to have this fixed.

As a workaround, this works

```
id := 1
var e1 User
db.Find(&e1, id)
```

Cheers.

A bit off topic, but I have a question about the MSSQL driver in general. Is it stable? Because I've tried using a simple Has One example and I just can't get that working either.

I'm going to do some more tests and probably file an issue if I can confirm something is acting strange.
IMO, mssql dialect does seem buggy at multiple places. However gorm provides some basic working functionality which should be enough for most of the cases.
Add a merge request to this @dipbhi

issue.title: Using "skip" clause with 0 value causes incorrect statement generation (MS SQL)

repository.name: SQLProvider
repository.description: A general F# SQL database erasing type provider, supporting LINQ queries, schema exploration, individuals, CRUD operations and much more besides.

issue.body:
### Description

We switched from FSharp.Data SQL Provider to SQLProvider and some queries that include "skip" count cause the following error:

**"Incorrect syntax near 'DESCOFFSET'.\r\nInvalid usage of the option NEXT in the FETCH statement."**

### Repro steps

Given the following F# query where skipCount is set to "0":

```
            query {
                for row in db.Dbo.EventJournal do
                where (row.PersistenceId = (sprintf "%s:%s" eventType eventId))
                groupBy row.PersistenceId into g
                sortBy g.Key
                skip skipCount
                take takeCount
                select g.Key
            }

```
The execution fails with the following error message:

**"Incorrect syntax near 'DESCOFFSET'.\r\nInvalid usage of the option NEXT in the FETCH statement."**

Workaround:
Removing "skip" and "take" clasues fixes the problem (perhaps just removing skip should be sufficient).

### Related information 

Microsoft SQL Server 2014
Any modern Windows OS

issue.title: MSSQL: fetch 0 rows doesn't work: Invalid usage of the option NEXT in the FETCH statement.

repository.name: gorm
repository.description: The fantastic ORM library for Golang, aims to be developer friendly

issue.body:
### What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
```
go version go1.9 linux/amd64
```

### Which database and its version are you using?
MSSQL 2012+

### What did you do?

Please provide a complete runnable program to reproduce your issue.

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/jinzhu/gorm"
	_ "github.com/jinzhu/gorm/dialects/mssql"
)

var db *gorm.DB

func init() {
	var err error
	db, err = gorm.Open("mssql", "sqlserver://gorm:LoremIpsum86@localhost:1433?database=gorm")
	if err != nil {
		panic(err)
	}
	db.LogMode(true)
}

type Result struct {
    TableCatalog string
    TableSchema string
    TableName string
    TableType string
}

// change this to 1 to see error go away
const nRows = 0

func main() {
     var result Result
     err := db.Raw(fmt.Sprintf("SELECT * FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES ORDER BY TABLE_NAME DESC OFFSET %d ROWS FETCH NEXT 0 ROWS ONLY", nRows)).Scan(&result).Error    
	if err != nil {
		panic(err)
	} else {
		fmt.Println("success")
	}
}
```

# Rationale

It is not possible to fetch 0 rows from what I can see with MSSQL 2012 and 2014. The fix to #1205 is not enough, apparently.

If you try to fetch 1 row, no error is returned.

The error is:
```
Invalid usage of the option NEXT in the FETCH statement.
```

If you try with MSSQL 2014+ instead:
```
The number of rows provided for a FETCH clause must be greater then zero.
```
(Test here: http://rextester.com/BSLOL96705)

body: Still not work with SQLServer 2008 R2

Still not working. 2019/12/01.
error message is:
`"mssql: Invalid usage of the option NEXT in the FETCH statement."`

Same issue. How can this basic function left broken for 3 years+ ? Why did I make myself the work yesterday using sqlite, thinking I can swap easily to sqlserver (as advertised by gorm) and now it's not "simply" working.

**And why is this issue closed?**
The issue for me was that I was missing `AUTO_INCREMENT;PRIMARY_KEY` after my Id column in my model
